level.text: 3302.1 Violation of any of the following provisions shall be a Class 1nfraction:

Submitting a document pursuant to the District of Columbia Official Codeitle 29 (Business Organizations) Enactment Act of 2010, effective July 11, 2011D.C. Law 18-378; D.C. Official Code §§ 29-101.01, et seq.) (the Act) and theocument contains a false statement;
Operating in the District:
As a domestic business corporation or professional corporation and withoutrticles of incorporation filed under D.C. Official Code § 29-302.02 (2011epl.);
As a domestic nonprofit corporation and without articles of incorporationiled under D.C. Official Code § 29-402.02 (2011 Repl.);
As a domestic limited liability partnership and without a statement ofualification filed under D.C. Official Code § 29-610.01 (2011 Repl.);
As a domestic limited partnership and without a certificate of limitedartnership filed under D.C. Official Code § 29-702.01 (2011 Repl.);
As a domestic limited liability company and without a certificate ofrganization filed under D.C. Official Code § 29-802.01 (2011 Repl.);
As a domestic general cooperative association and without articles ofncorporation filed under D.C. Official Code § 29-906 (2011 Repl.);
As a domestic limited cooperative association and without articles ofrganization filed under D.C. Official Code § 29-1003.02 (2011 Repl.); or
As a domestic statutory trust and without a certificate of trust filed under.C. Official Code § 29-1202.01 (2011 Repl.);
Operating in the District as a foreign filing business organization entity:
Without having obtained a certificate of registration under D.C. Official Code 29-105.02 (2011 Repl.); or
After its certificate of registration has been terminated under D.C. Officialode § 29-105.11 (2011 Repl.); and

Operating in the District under the jurisdiction of the Act, but after theusiness organization has been dissolved, whether voluntarily, judicially, ordministratively; provided, that this subsection shall not apply if theissolution has been revoked or the business organization has been reinstated inccordance with the Act.
3302.2 Violation of any of the following provisions shall be a Class 3nfraction:
Failure to appoint and maintain a registered agent under D.C. Official Code 29-104.02 (2011 Repl.):
As a domestic filing entity;
As a domestic limited liability partnership that does not maintain a placef business in the District; or
As a qualified foreign entity; and
Failure to register a trade name with the Department of Consumer andegulatory Affairs under D.C. Official Code § 47-2855.02 (2005 Repl.):
As a general partnership;
As a foreign or domestic limited partnership;
As a foreign or domestic limited liability company; or
As a foreign or domestic corporation.

level.heading: SOURCE
level.text: Final Rulemaking published at 52 DCR 4908 (May 27, 2005); as amended byinal Rulemaking published at 59 DCR 8162 (July 6, 2012).
